Module kivakit.core.kernel
Package com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.messaging.listeners

Class MessageChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.messaging.broadcasters.Multicaster
      • com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.messaging.repeaters.BaseRepeater
        • com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.messaging.listeners.MessageChecker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Receiver<Transmittable>, Transmitter<Transmittable>, NamedObject, PackagePathed, Broadcaster, Listener, Repeater, Transceiver
    public class MessageChecker
extends BaseRepeater
    Listens to messages to determine if the expected number and type of messages were received during some operation. Expected messages are added with expect(Class) and expect(Class, int) and after the operation has finished the messages can be checked with check(). For example, the following code should broadcast a Problem message and return null. 
     new MessageChecker().expect(Problem.class).check(() ->
     ensureEqual(null, new Duration.SecondsConverter(Listener.none()).convert("x")));
    Author:
    jonathanl (shibo)

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean check()
      Checks to see if the correct count of each expected message has been received and not any other messages
      MessageChecker check​(java.lang.Runnable code)
      Runs the given code and then checks messages received
      MessageChecker expect​(java.lang.Class<? extends Message> messageClass)
      Registers that one message the given type should be received
      MessageChecker expect​(java.lang.Class<? extends Message> messageClass, int count)
      Registers an expected number of messages of the given class
      void onMessage​(Message message)
      Receives a message and adds it to the list of messages
